column4: I'm having trouble getting my wireless working w/o roaming mode, but it works fine with roaming mode
any suggestions on what to check to see what's going wrong?
do you have an atheros card? if you do, either get REALLY close to your access point, or user ndiswrapper
I've got one too. it's a known issue with the madwifi (ath_pci) driver
what kind of graphics card do you have?
is it a recent problem that has come up, cause it work before
a nvidia gf 6800

yeah. same issue here. what's going on is that nvidia and ath_pci are both part of the linux-restricted-drivers package. what you need to do is uninstall that, and then install ndiswrapper and manually install the nvidia driver
it's annoying. I fought with it for a week before I got it to work
will yours work with roaming mode on via networkmanager before you fixed it?
it showed networks, but I couldn't connect to them, unless I was literally within five feet of the AP
hmm, see mine works great in roaming mode, but I want it to log onto the network at boot, and it's a desktop, so not switching APs
you mean that you want it to connect before X starts?
yes
hm...what kind of wireless connection is it? 64-bit hex? 128-bit passphrase? Etc.
WPA-Personal

dang. I've actually been trying to figure out how to connect to non 64-bit networks by command-line. it wouldn't be too hard to write a script that starts up your wireless at boot, but I don't know how to connect to WPA-Personal via command-line.
I'm wondering if something with WPA supplicant isn't messed up on it
can you connect once you've already booted up?
i see...
thanks for your help
no prob. sorry I couldn't help more
